page.title: 07Traffic on A737,Paisley
page.content: A survey was taken of the traffic which passes our school. We took two surveys, one on the afternoon of{ {Tuesday 28th May}and another on the morning of{Wednesday 29th May 1985}. A total of{1841}vehicles passed altogether. The commonest type of vehicles was the car with{1405};{261} lorries,{21}bikes,{80}buses and{76} private vans also passed the{John {Neilson HS}. There is no doubt that the {A737}is a very busy road and therefore dangerous.This causes great concern as there are many houses and schools in the area and children are constantly in danger as they tend not to use pedestrian crossings. Only recently, one of our younger pupils was knocked down and fractured his hip.
